üìä Container Fields Explained

Purpose: Primary identifier for the container

Format: Department-Year-Number (e.g., HR-2024-0001)

Rules:

  • Minimum 4 digits required
  • Must be unique across system
  • Auto-increments if you leave blank

Options:

  • 1 - Public: General business records
  • 2 - Internal: Company confidential
  • 3 - Confidential: Restricted access
  • 4 - Highly Confidential: Executive/legal only

Impact: Controls who can view/access container

Purpose: How long to keep before eligible for destruction

Examples:

  • Tax Records: 7 years
  • Employee Files: 7 years after termination
  • Medical Records: Varies by state (often 10+ years)

Auto-Alerts: System warns when retention period expires

üîí NAID AAA Compliance & Reporting

Maintaining audit trails and generating compliance reports

üõ°Ô∏è What is NAID AAA Compliance?

NAID (National Association for Information Destruction) sets the standard for secure document destruction.

AAA Certification means we follow the highest security protocols:

  • Accountability - Complete chain of custody tracking
  • Assurance - Destruction certificates for every job
  • Audit - Regular third-party compliance audits

üìã Chain of Custody Tracking

Every Action is Logged:
Event Data Captured Purpose
Container Created User, timestamp, initial location Establish baseline
Container Moved From/to location, mover, reason Track physical custody
Barcode Scanned Scanner ID, location, GPS coordinates Verify current location
Access Granted Who, when, why, duration Security audit trail
Destruction Requested Requestor signature, approver, date Legal authorization
Destruction Completed Method, certificate, witness Compliance proof
